description: **Agastache 'Raspberry Fizz'** is a dwarf perennial that grows to 25cm with scented green leaves and stems, producing upright flower spikes of vibrant raspberry pink flowers. These long-lasting blooms appear from mid-summer to the end of autumn, attracting pollinators and beneficial insects. The aromatic leaves have a lemon-mint flavour, perfect for herbal tea, and the flowers are also edible. Compact plants thrive in containers, rockeries, dry gardens, and cottage gardens, tolerating drought and poor soils.

This drought-tolerant agave thrives in rock gardens, coastal conditions, and containers, making it an ideal accent plant for beds and borders.

description: **Benary's Princess Asters** are a stunning annual, growing up to 70cm tall, with upright stems bearing toothed green leaves and intense pink flowers featuring yellow centres. This old-fashioned garden favourite produces long-lasting cut flowers that are perfect for adding a pop of colour to any arrangement. With premium seeds developed specifically for professional cut flower producers, these asters boast excellent form and are held on strong, long stems. The fully double, pompom-like blooms come in clear colours with crested yellow centres, making them ideal as cut flowers or for growing in beds and borders. Tolerant of challenging conditions, including wet soil, these versatile plants are also known by their other names: 'China Aster', 'Crown Aster', or 'Annual Aster'.

description: **Benary's Princess Asters** are a beautiful annual, reaching up to 70cm tall, with upright stems featuring toothed green leaves and large flowers that soften from soft yellow in the centre to white. This timeless garden favourite produces long-lasting cut flowers that will bring a touch of whimsy to any arrangement. With high-quality seeds developed for professional cut flower producers, these asters display excellent form on strong, long stems. The fully double, pompom-like blooms come in clear colours with crested yellow centres, making them perfect as cut flowers or for growing in beds and borders. Tolerant of challenging conditions, including wet soil, these adaptable plants are also known by their other names: 'China Aster', 'Crown Aster', or 'Annual Aster'.
additional_information: Yellow Flowers; Cut flowers

It's a slow-growing, drought-tolerant evergreen or semi-deciduous tree that makes an excellent feature tree.

This drought-tolerant plant boasts slender lobed leaves up to 8cm long on reddish stems, accompanied by cup-shaped daisy flowers in a mix of colours (predominantly yellow and orange with occasional beige-pink and white blooms). Flowers fold at night and on overcast days but attract butterflies and bees. Suitable for rockeries, dry gardens, mass plantings, borders, containers, and poor sandy soils.

description: . **Cobaea scandens** (synonyms: 'Cup and Saucer Vine', 'Mexican Ivy', 'Monastery Bells') - a perennial climbing vine producing a mix of purple and white bell-shaped flowers up to 5cm in length. In temperate climates, it can be grown as an annual. Flowers appear from late summer until late autumn, starting with white buds that mature into either deeper purple or pure white blooms. Once established, Cobaea grows rapidly, requiring protection from young vines being sensitive to frost. Its fast growth makes it ideal for tropical gardens, trellises, covering fences, arbors, and west-facing walls.

plant_type: Annual 80cm; Red, pink and white striped flowers; Excellent for mass planting
position: Full sun, moist well drained soil
sowing_method: Sow direct or raise seedlings
description: **Cosmos bipinnatus** (varies): Annual to 100cm with finely cut dark green foliage. Its large flowers have striking contrasting colour patterns: deep red overlaid with white stripes, plain deep red and white with red edges. This variety is excellent for mass planting and cut flowers, and has earned the Royal Horticultural Society's Award of Garden Merit. Also suitable for beds, border, and meadow planting. plant_type: Multistemmed tree to 8m; Foliage suited to floristry; Ornamental 'minni ritchie' bark
position: Full sun, well drained soil

description: **Minni Ritchi Eucalyptus**: This stunning large shrub or small tree grows up to 8m tall, with multiple stems characteristic of mallee eucalypts. Its silver-grey leaves are oval to heart-shaped, measuring 2.5-4cm long, and can be used as a foliage filler in bouquets and floristry. Creamy white to pale yellow flowers bloom in winter and spring, attracting birds to the area. The tree's ornamental bark is reddish-brown, continuously peeling and curling to expose lighter-coloured bark on the trunk. Native to arid regions of Western and Central Australia, this eucalyptus thrives in areas with dry summers and low humidity. It can be grown in a large container to restrict its height.
additional_information: White/Cream Flowers; Drought tolerant; Ornamental use
seed_type: Open pollinated, untreated, non-GMO variety of seed

position: Full sun, well drained soil

description: **Silver Princess Eucalyptus**: This beautiful small tree grows up to 14m tall, with grey-green leaves and weeping, pendulous branches. Its juvenile leaves are green and rounded, while adult leaves are lanceolate and 10-14cm long. Large pink or red flowers appear in autumn and winter, followed by large ornamental gumnuts covered in a powdery white powder giving the plant a silvery appearance. The 'minni ritchi' bark is reddish-brown, continuously peeling and curling to expose lighter-coloured bark on the trunk. Use as a feature tree in native gardens or as a single specimen. Attracts birds.

description: **Rosmarinus officinalis**: Dense, spreading evergreen shrub growing to 3m x 3m with fine needle-like aromatic foliage. Waxy pink, white or mauve 5-petalled flowers smother the shrub in winter and spring, attracting bees, butterflies, and other insects. The aromatic flowers are used extensively in floristry due to their long vase life. Drought tolerant once established. Plant as a feature shrub in a native or waterwise garden.

position: Full sun, moist well drained soil

description: **Gladiolus grandiflorus** is a versatile herbaceous perennial growing up to 120-150cm tall, with thin green upright leaves and showy spikes of beautiful dusty coppery pink flowers featuring a contrasting white throat. These tough, economical, reliable corms can thrive in all climates. The tall flower spikes provide stunning vertical accents in gardens, blooming in spring in warm climates and in summer in cool regions. Plant them in drifts or clumps of 5-7 corms in borders and beds, cottage gardens or en masse for a dramatic display. An excellent cut flower picked when the first bud on a flower spike opens, gladiolus also rewards continuous blooming by planting in succession every 4 weeks. Also known as 'Sword Lilies'.
additional_information: Pink/Rose Flowers; Cut flowers; Borders; Beds; Mass plantings; Ornamental use

description: **Gumby Gumby** (*Pittosporum phillyraeoides*): This weeping evergreen shrub or small tree grows up to 4m in height, with long, narrow green leaves that are perfect for containers or large gardens. In late winter to spring, it produces small yellow to cream flowers followed by round, inedible orange fruits containing orange-red seeds. Indigenous Australians used the leaves to make a medicinal tea for coughs and colds, skin irritation, and lactation support. The tea can be made with fresh or dried leaves using one or two leaves per cup.

description: **Iris foetidissima**: This clump-forming perennial boasts strappy leaves and dull, yellow-tinged, pale mauve flowers. The showstopper is the large pods that burst open with vibrant bright orange-red seeds. Plants reach 30-60cm tall. Its unique feature? The leaves emit a pungent scent, reminiscent of burnt rubber or roast beef, earning it its common name - stinking iris. As a bare-rooted plant, it's dug up during winter dormancy, pruned, and sold without soil.
additional_information: Cut flowers; Borders; Beds; Mass plantings

Plant them in a perennial border or bed where they can soak up dry, well-drained soil. With medicinal uses, they're an excellent addition to any garden.

description: **Moldavian Balm** (Melissa officinalis) This annual herb is a lemon-scented delight, with grey-green leaves and spikes of blue flowers that resemble a dragon's head in shape. Its leaves and young shoots can be used fresh or dried to make tea, retaining their citrusy fragrance when dried. A strong lemon flavor makes them an excellent substitute for fresh lemons or lemon balm, with a history of medicinal use and essential oil extraction. Bees adore its flowers!

Native to central and south America, it thrives in warm weather and can be invasive in regions with mild winters.

description: **Phacelia tanacetifolia** Annual growing to 70cm with fine feathery green leaves and clusters of nectar-rich lavender blue flowers held above the foliage. These blooms attract bees, hoverflies, and parasitic wasps, making _phacelia_ a popular choice for bee keepers in the US and Europe as a cover crop. It thrives in beds or mixed borders, tolerating poor soils, drought, and light frosts. Native to Arizona, California, Nevada, and northwest Mexico, it's also known as 'Purple tansy', 'Lacy phacelia', 'Fiddleneck', and 'Lacy scorpionweed'.

description: **Portulaca (Rose Moss)**: This semi-succulent annual grows up to 20cm with small fleshy bright green leaves and double flowers in an assortment of colours. Its fast growth rate and spreading habit make it suitable for garden borders, rockeries, as a ground cover, hanging baskets, or container plants. It thrives in poor soil and is drought-tolerant. Also known by various names such as _Rose Moss, Time Flower, Eleven O Clock, Vietnam Rose, Mexican rose, Sun Rose, Rock Rose_, and _Moss-Rose Purslane and Moss Rose_.

description: **Pixie Lily**: This 'pixie' or 'pot Asiatic' lily boasts short stems with bright tomato red flowers. Each stem produces 4-5 upward-facing flowers. The long, glossy lance-shaped leaves grow in a dense spiral arrangement on the stems. Pot Asiatic lilies (also called 'Pixie' lilies) have compact stems growing 40-60cm tall and are suited for small gardens or clumps at the front of beds and borders. Bulbs can be left in the garden to bloom year after year.

description: **Potentilla**: This deciduous perennial shrub grows up to 70cm with finely textured leaves and double flowers in a mix of orange, red, and gold – sometimes featuring bicoloured blooms. It has a long flowering period from mid-summer to the end of autumn. Suited for mixed borders and beds amongst other perennials in temperate and cool climates, this variety is easy to grow and attracts bees. Native to North America, potentilla is also known as 'Cinquefoil' and 'Shrubby Cinquefoil'.

plant_type: Drought tolerant fruit tree; Fruit can be eaten raw or cooked; Use in jams and chutneys
position: Full sun
sowing_method: Sow direct or raise seedlings
description: **Quandong (Santalum acuminatum)**: This attractive small tree grows 2-4m tall, boasting long grey-green drooping foliage, small white flowers, and brightly coloured edible fruit. The bright red fruit is 2-5cm across, harvested between August and December. It's a member of the sandalwood family, thriving in arid and semi-arid areas of mainland Australia. Quandong tolerates drought and salinity once established. Its tangy taste combines sweet and tart notes; it can be eaten fresh, stewed, dried, or used in jams and chutneys. Traditionally, seed kernels treated toothache, while hard seeds were used as beads. As a semi-parasitic plant, Quandong often uses host plants like [Raspberry Jam Wattle](https://www.theseedcollection.com.au/raspberry-jam-wattle) or native grasses to access water and nutrients.
additional_information: Container growing; Drought tolerant; Ornamental use

description: **Elegance Italian Ranunculus**: This perennial blooms with fully double flowers in late winter or spring, reaching 40cm tall. Its petals are white-edged with soft pink, earning the name 'Sfumato', meaning 'nuanced' in Italian. Suitable for cut flower production and beds/borders, Elegance Italian ranunculus produce large, fully double flowers packed with petals on strong stems. Mature plants bloom over 6 weeks, producing 4-12 flowers per plant in the first season and up to 20 per plant later on. Seed-grown plants yield corms that can be lifted and replanted the following season.

plant_type: Fast-growing shrub or small tree; Cut wood smells like raspberry jam; Fluffy yellow flowers in spring
position: Full or part sun, moist well drained soil

description: . **Desmond Cole's Jam Tree** A fast-growing tall shrub or small tree growing up to 5m tall, with narrow leaves (phyllodes) reaching 10cm long. In spring, the tree is covered in cylindrical fluffy yellow flowers followed by flattened seed pods. Makes an excellent feature tree or privacy screen for native gardens, and serves as a companion or host plant to [Quandong](https://www.theseedcollection.com.au/quandong). Indigenous uses include grinding seeds into flour, using orange-colored resin in tea, and crafting tools from the hardwood, prized by woodworkers for its sweet aroma. Native to southwest and wheatbelt areas of Western Australia, also known as 'Jam Tree', 'Raspberry Jam Tree', or by indigenous (Noongar) names 'Manjart', 'Munertor', 'Mungeitch', and 'Mungat'.
additional_information: Ornamental use

It grows up to 150cm tall with an open habit and distinctive red-capped flower buds that burst into large bright yellow-green flowers in summer and autumn. This native plant attracts native birds and bees and tolerates drought and poor soil quality.

plant_type: Evergreen tree to 7m; Edible fruit; Ornamental bark and flowers
position: Full or part sun, moist well drained soil
sowing_method: **Raise seedlings:** This means seeds are best started off in trays or other containers and then transplanted to their final position once they are established
description: **Strawberry Tree** *Arbutus unedo* is an evergreen shrub or small tree growing up to 7m with a rounded canopy. Its dark green leaves, ornamental stringy cinnamon-colored bark, and clusters of dainty white bell-shaped flowers in autumn and winter are sure to impress. But that's not all - the fruit is edible and turns from green to orange and then bright red when ripe! It takes up to a year for the fruit to ripen on the tree, but it's worth the wait. Enjoy it raw or use it to make jams, jellies, and sauces due to its mealy texture. The flavor is sweet-tart and tropical, with hints of mango, apricot, peach, and guava. In Portugal, the fruit is used to make a traditional liqueur called 'medronho'. Native to the Mediterranean and later introduced to Ireland, it's suited to temperate and cold climates. Also known as 'Irish Strawberry Tree', 'Killarney Strawberry Tree', 'Cane Apple', and 'Dalmation Strawberry'. Note: *Strawberry Tree* is considered invasive in some council areas of Australia; check before planting.
additional_information: Culinary use; Ornamental use
seed_type: Open pollinated, untreated, non-GMO variety of seed

plant_type: Annual to 20cm; Australian Native Wildflower
position: Full sun, well drained soil
sowing_method: **Sow direct:** This means that the seeds are best sown directly into the garden
description: **Sturt's Desert Pea** *Swainsonia formosa* is a well-known Australian native desert wildflower, commonly seen in dry arid conditions. It grows well in dry hot inland conditions and sandy soils, with a prostrate habit and very long tap roots. Its grey to green leaves produce large vivid red flowers with black, brown, or dark red centers (known as a boss). This stunning cut flower is a must-have for any garden! Sturt's Desert Pea is also known as 'Ngooringa' and is the floral emblem of South Australia. Loves dry warm climates, full sun, and sandy soils. Note: Seeds of many native plants are dormant and will not germinate until ideal environmental conditions are met. Follow instructions for pre-treatment and sowing, and be patient; some wild-harvested seeds can take much longer to germinate than expected.
additional_information: Red/Crimson Flowers; Cut flowers; Drought tolerant; Ornamental use

description: **AOA Lilies**: These vibrant flowers boast *golden yellow-apricot* petals with deeper red flames and maroon freckles, creating a striking appearance. Their 15cm wide blooms have slightly reflexed petals and a noticeable but not overpowering fragrance. Long, glossy lance-shaped leaves grow in a spiral arrangement on the stems, producing up to 7 flowers each. AOA lilies are crosses between Asiatic and Oriental lilies, growing 70-100cm tall with multiple flowers per stem. They're easy to grow, reliable performers in the garden that will bloom year after year from November into January.
additional_information: Orange Flowers; Yellow Flowers; Container growing; Cut flowers; Borders; Beds; Ornamental use

description: **Bearded Iris**: This herbaceous perennial boasts stunning sword-shaped grey-green leaves that grow up to 60cm tall, while flower stems reach an impressive 90cm in height. The vibrant flowers feature violet upright petals (standards) with a hint of lemon yellow, paired with violet lower petals (falls) tinged with tan near the centre. A delicate tan-bearded throat adds a pop of colour. Each stem produces up to 9 buds in late spring or summer, making it an ideal long-lasting cut flower. Bearded iris thrives in borders and garden beds, and can be divided after flowering.

description: **Bearded Iris**: With its sword-shaped grey-green leaves and sturdy upright stems, this herbaceous perennial is sure to impress. The flowers boast solid, rich purple upper (standard) and lower (falls) petals, while the slightly ruffled lower petals add a touch of texture. A white-purple beard in the throat completes the look. Each stem produces up to 9 buds in late spring or summer, classifying it as a mid-season bloomer. A long-lasting cut flower, bearded iris is perfect for borders and garden beds.

plant_type: Pink lily-like flowers; Blooms late summer to autumn; Also called 'Naked Ladies'
sowing_depth: Plant with 1/3rd of bulb above soil level

sowing_method: **Sow direct:** This means that the seeds are best sown directly into the garden
description: . **Crinum**: This fragrant herbaceous perennial grows to 60cm, boasting trumpet-shaped flowers that resemble lilies in vibrant pink hues. Blooming on purple stems in late summer or early autumn, each stem produces 3-6 flowers, while mature bulbs can bloom with up to 15 flowers each. The glossy green strappy foliage emerges after flowering, growing until spring then dying down over summer. Plant in garden beds and borders where clumps can establish, or in large containers. A long-lasting cut flower, crinum is also known as 'Amaryllis Lilies' or 'Naked Ladies', due to its unique flowering pattern. Native to South Africa, it's tough, easy to grow, low maintenance, and drought tolerant once established – but be sure to handle with care, as all parts of the bulb, flowers, and plants are toxic to cats, dogs, and humans.
additional_information: Pink/Rose Flowers; Container growing; Cut flowers; Borders; Beds; Ornamental use

description: **Naked Ladies** (Zephyranthes candida) A fragrant herbaceous perennial growing up to 60cm, with white trumpet-shaped flowers resembling lilies that bloom on green stems in early autumn. Each stem produces 3-6 flowers, while mature bulbs can bloom with up to 15 flowers each. The glossy green strappy foliage emerges after flowering, typically in late autumn or winter, and grows until spring before dying down over summer. Native to South Africa, this plant is tough, easy to grow, low maintenance, and drought-tolerant once established. It prefers to be left undisturbed for several years to produce the best blooms.

description: **Caper Plant**, also known as 'Flinders Rose', is a perennial shrub with sprawling branches of rounded blue-green foliage. The buds are harvested young and pickled to create capers, often used as a seasoning or garnish with their pungent salty flavour. If allowed to mature, the flowers feature white petals and purple filaments, making them an attractive addition to ornamental gardens. Native to the Mediterranean region, this plant thrives in hot dry climates and has a history of medicinal use.

Native to Ukraine and Armenia, this variety has been awarded the Royal Horticultural Society's Award of Garden Merit. It thrives in containers, gravel gardens, rockeries, and mass planting.

Prefers part or dappled shade and is suitable for all climates. Sow at a rate of 10g per square meter if using as a lawn alternative.

description: **Gladiolus grandiflorus** is also known as *Gladiolus*, but don't be fooled – this herbaceous perennial has multiple stunning varieties! Growing up to 120-150cm, its thin green upright leaves provide a striking backdrop for showy spikes of ruffled flowers in deep velvet red. Gladioli are tough, economical, and reliable corms that can thrive in all climates. Plant them in drifts or clumps of 5-7 corms in borders and beds, cottage gardens or en masse.

plant_type: Trailing perennial vine to 150cm; Soft pink pea-like flowers; Use as a climber or groundcover
position: Full or part sun, well drained soil
sowing_method: **Raise seedlings:** This means seeds are best started off in trays or other containers and then transplanted to their final position once they are established
description: **Hardenbergia violaceae** (Pink Coral Pea) An evergreen trailing perennial vine or bush that grows 1m to 3m tall, boasting large, green, leathery leaves and racemes of soft pink pea-like flowers in winter and spring. This variety is less vigorous than its purple counterpart, making it perfect for individual planting in mixed beds, mass planting as a groundcover, or screening fences. It attracts native butterflies and blooms best in full sun. Also known as 'Native Sarsaparilla', 'False Sarsaparilla', and 'Pink Coral Pea'. Note that seeds of many native plants are dormant and require pre-treatment before sowing.

plant_type: Herbaceous peony; Large, deep coral-pink flowers; Good cut flower
position: Full sun, moist well-drained soil
sowing_method: Close
description: **Paeonia lactiflora** ('Coral Charm') This reliable herbaceous peony boasts deep coral-pink buds that open to form large, semi-double flowers (18cm) in early spring. As the flowers mature, their color shifts through shades of peach to creamy yellow. 'Coral Charm' is a 1964 introduction and holds both the RHS Award of Garden Merit and the 1986 American Peony Society Gold Medal. Herbaceous peonies are vigorous bushy perennials that flower prolifically in late spring and early summer, making them perfect for cut flower arrangements.
additional_information: Pink/Rose Flowers; Cut flowers; Ornamental use

description: **Paeonia 'Red Charm'** This stunning herbaceous peony features large, double flowers with magenta-red to cerise petals that have a ruffled texture. The flowers are not perfumed, but the plant's reliability makes it a standout variety. Introduced in 1881 and holding the RHS Award of Garden Merit, this peony is perfect for gardeners seeking a low-maintenance yet dramatic addition to their borders.

position: Full sun, well drained soil
sowing_method: Sow direct or raise seedlings
description: **Papaver radicatum**, also known as the *Arctic Poppy*, is a short-lived perennial (often grown as a biennial) that reaches 45cm in height. Its compact mound of blue/grey leaves and short hairy flower stems produce lightly scented single flowers in a mix of orange, yellow, red, pink, and white blooms. This versatile plant thrives in beds, borders, rockeries, cottage gardens, mass plantings, and as a cut flower. It's an excellent choice for attracting bees and butterflies to your garden. Its cold alpine climate tolerance makes it well-suited to harsher environments.

description: **Jonquils** have been delighting gardeners since the 18th century with their heirloom variety 'Seventeen Sisters', which boasts prolific clusters of flowers on each stem. The ivory white petals surround a tiny pale yellow cup, emitting a very strong and sweet fragrance. These early-blooming daffodils are perfect for containers, beds, or borders under deciduous trees or en masse. Plant in groups of at least 5 bulbs for the best display, as they make an excellent cut flower.

description: _Narcissus pseudonarcissus_, also known as a double narcissus, is a herbaceous perennial reaching 45cm in height. Its fully double creamy white flowers with saffron yellow centres often have one to three blooms per stem. This large-flowered variety is sometimes classified as a small-flowered double daffodil and features strongly scented blooms. Awarded the Royal Horticultural Society's Award of Garden Merit, this Jonquil excels in beds, borders, containers, or en masse under deciduous trees.

description: **LA Hybrid Lily**: This beautiful lily boasts clear mid-pink flowers that face upwards, with little to no fragrance. The stems carry multiple blooms, increasing in number as the bulbs become established. LA Hybrids are crosses between Lilium longiflorum (Easter lilies) and Asiatic lilies, boasting larger flowers, stronger stems, and a longer vase life than their Asian counterparts. They grow up to 70cm tall with closely clustered flowers, making them ideal for garden beds, borders, containers, and as excellent cut flowers.

description: **Prickly Currant** (*Coprosma spp.*) - This evergreen shrub grows 1-2m high and 1.5m wide with small glossy green leaves, stiff branches, and occasional prickles. Producing small green flowers in spring followed by orange to red berry-like edible fruits up to 1cm wide in summer and autumn, it's a great choice for native or bush food gardens, particularly in cold climates. Native to NSW, Victoria, and Tasmania in subalpine climates, this plant is also known as 'Shining Coprosma' and attracts birds with its sweet fruits.

Perfect for rockeries, dry gardens, containers, or cut flowers, it's native to western Victoria, eastern South Australia, and western NSW.

Featuring double florets that are mid-blue with white edges and tightly packed on strong stems, this long-lasting flower deepens from blue to purple as it ages, then fades to green/yellow. Easy to grow and naturalizing in cool climates, it's perfect for mass planting under deciduous trees or in borders, rockeries, edging, and containers.

description: **Butterfly Iris** (*Muiria pseudogerrardii*): This strappy perennial grows to 35cm, producing iris-like flowers with three white petals marked by distinctive iridescent blue 'nectar guides' or 'eyes', resembling peacock feathers. The 5cm wide flowers are freckled with violet on the reverse and bloom for 3-4 days in succession over several weeks. Green strappy leaves emerge in late winter, followed by flowers in spring. Bulbs become dormant over summer. Native to the Cape region of South Africa, where it is critically endangered.

Attracting bees and butterflies with ease, this low-maintenance beauty is perfect for home gardeners. Also known as "Garden Phlox", "Perennial Phlox", or "Summer Phlox".

description: **Scabiosa atropurpurea**: This short-lived perennial reaches 90cm in height, featuring serrated mid-green leaves and tall wiry stems adorned with large solitary flower heads in shades of lavender to pale blue. Ideal for cut flowers, cottage gardens, borders, and beds, this drought-tolerant gem is a magnet for bees, butterflies, and beneficial insects. With a rich history of medicinal uses, it was once employed to treat scabies. Also known as "Sweet Scabious", "Pincushions", "Mournful Widow", or "Scabieuse".

An excellent cut flower, it adds a touch of whimsy to borders and cottage gardens while attracting beneficial predatory insects and pollinators.

description: **Snow Crocus** (Crocus tommasinianus) A hardy perennial that blooms in late winter or early spring, producing goblet-shaped flowers in a variety of colors, including deep cream, ivory, and golden yellow. The delicate flowers are lightly scented and provide an early source of nectar for insects. Each corm produces one to four flowers that open during the day and close at night. Native to Hungary, Bulgaria, and parts of Turkey, this low-maintenance plant naturalizes easily in containers or mass plantings.

Native to the Mediterranean region, this drought-tolerant plant will multiply to form clumps over time.

plant_type: Evergreen small tree; Fixes nitrogen in the soil; Flowers attract bees
position: Full sun, moist well drained soil
sowing_method: **Raise seedlings:** This means seeds are best started off in trays or other containers and then transplanted to their final position once they are established
description: **Tree Lucerne** - *Chamaecytisus proliferus* This evergreen small tree from the Canary Islands typically grows to 5m but is often pruned to 1-2m. With its weeping habit, it boasts 7cm long grey-green leaves divided into three leaflets. In late winter and spring, scented white pea-like flowers attract bees, followed by flat seed pods. Its fast-growing nitrogen-fixing properties make it a valuable asset in permaculture for soil improvement. It can be grown as a windbreak or fodder plant in dry climates, and its long tap roots help access water deep in the soil.
additional_information: White/Cream Flowers; Attracts beneficial insects; Ornamental use

position: Full or part sun, well drained soil

description: **Flore Pleno Tiger Lily** - *Lilium lancifolium* This stunning double form of Tiger Lily features orange-red, recurved petals covered in dark purple-black spots. Its semi-pendant flowers are pollen-free. Found across China, Japan, and the Korean Peninsula, this "Flore Pleno" (double-flowered) variety has 1.2m tall stems, making it perfect for garden beds, borders, containers, or as a cut flower. With up to 12 blooms per stem, these Tiger lilies are easy to grow and will return year after year.

description: **Flame Flower** - *Cotyledon orbiculata* This herbaceous perennial grows 20-50cm tall, boasting green strappy foliage alongside freesia-like creamy white flowers that bloom in late spring. As they're unscented, they make an excellent choice for allergy sufferers. Suited to growing in clumps or drifts in garden beds and borders, rockeries, or containers, this easy-to-grow variety is native to the Cape Province region of South Africa.
